intro: Capparis domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican coral tree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its woody, thorny stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, round, yellowish fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
